intro: Macairea scabra, commonly known as the rough macairea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
